subject: Re: [junit] need help
msgSnippet: You should try to make each test() method independent of other test() methods. If you disable one or more test methods (by commenting them) then this should
messageBody:
You should try to make each test() method independent of other
test() methods. If you disable one or more test methods (by commenting them)
then this should not interfere with other test methods. And you cant
be sure in the order of the tests either, the tests in the bottom of the
class may be tested first and vice-versa.


Since each test() method invocation is executed on a new instance
of the TestCase class, then you must setup everything before each test.

Write a setUp() method, this method is invoked before each test in the
TestCase. In this you should prepare all variables/resources that are needed
by the testcases, for instance in your class populat the CDlist with
values that are used in the different tests.


If you need to do some clean up after each test, then implement
the tearDown() method, which is invoked after each test. (unless there
was an Error when testing)


BTW, what are you trying to test in your testGetData()?



public class ClientDataListTest extends TestCase
{
/** omitted */
protected void setUp() throws Exception
{
// fix all variables that are needed for ALL tests
}
protected void tearDown() throws Exception
{
// do some clean up IF necessary
}
/** the rest of the class */
}


> Hi,
>
> How can I take the value of variable of my tested class in other testcase
> ( test function ) which is updated in my another testcase.
>
> My tested class put,get and delete the data from Hashtable
>
> --------------------------------------------------
>
> import junit.framework.*;
>
> public class ClientDataListTest extends TestCase
> {
> /* instance of tested class */
> ClientDataList cdList = new ClientDataList();
>
> public static void main (String[] args)
> {
> junit.textui.TestRunner.run (suite());
> }
> public static Test suite()
> {
> return new TestSuite(ClientDataListTest.class);
> }
> public void testUpdateData()
> {
> String clientData = "";
>
> cdList.updateData(1,"1","query1");
> cdList.updateData(2,"2","query2");
> cdList.updateData(1,"1","query3");
> assertEquals("query3",cdList.getClientData(1));
> assertNotSame(clientData,cdList.getClientData(2));
> assertSame(clientData,cdList.getClientData(3));
> }
> public void testGetData()
> {
> String clientData = "";
>
> assertEquals("query3",cdList.getClientData(1));
> assertNotSame(clientData,cdList.getClientData(2));
> assertSame(clientData,cdList.getClientData(3));
> }
> }
>
> I got the following result:
>
> ..F
> Time: 0.03
> There was 1 failure:
> 1) testGetData(ClientDataListTest)junit.framework.ComparisonFailure:
> expected:<query3> but was:<>
> at ClientDataListTest.testGetData(ClientDataListTest.java:65)
> at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
> at
> sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39
> )
> at
> sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl
> .java:25)
> at ClientDataListTest.main(ClientDataListTest.java:45)
>
> FAILURES!!!
> Tests run: 2, Failures: 1, Errors: 0
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------
>
> Thank you.
>
> - Mukund Patel
